Main_Services: ['mental health care', 'navigating the system']
Eligibility: ['For Medi-Cal beneficiaries ages 0-21 and their families.']
Description: California MENTOR believes children belong in the family home whenever it is safe and possible. Through our Family Support Services, we help families of youth at risk with complex mental health, behavioral and other needs overcome the challenges they face together.  Our diverse, multilingual specialists support families from a wide range of backgrounds who may be facing:- Out-of-home placements or reunification- Trauma from substance abuse and domestic violence- Involvement with the juvenile justice system- Behavioral and mental health challengesFamily Support Services are provided by a specially trained Child and Family Team that develops a uniquely tailored Plan of Care (POC), based on the child’s strengths and needs and respecting family culture and preferences.  Our master’s-level therapists create personalized plans and work with family members who play an active role in helping children achieve unique goals that may include:- Working through any crisis in a positive way.- Identifying a family’s natural strengths and supports in the community that can help them continue moving forward.- Developing communication skills to strengthen family and community relationships.Depending on each family’s unique needs, Family Support Services may use Family Centered Treatment® (FCT), an evidence-based model of family preservation designed to help families who are at risk learn, grow and interact in a positive way.At Riverside Intensive Outpatient Mental health, we deliver care consistent with that received at our main facility. We recognize that a high percentage of our clients are better served close to their homes. To start, please visit our website to fill out our referral form or call us to initiate intake process.Serving Medi-Cal beneficiaries ages 0-21 and their families.
Coverage: This program covers residents of the following counties: Riverside County, CA.

Main_Services: ['psychiatric emergency services', 'addiction & recovery', 'residential treatment', 'mental health care', 'group therapy', 'medications for mental health']
Description: Many people in all walks of life experience drug and alcohol problems that limit their ability to fully enjoy life and also harm their family and friends. People are reluctant to address these difficulties even with their closest friends and family members. Many times they are not even aware that the problems exist or do not recognize the symptoms. Here at Whiteside Manor, trained drug and alcohol intervention staff are available to help coax your loved one into treatment.When a person is affected by both psychiatric illness and chemical dependency, they are suffering from co-occurring conditions, known as Dual Diagnosis. Psychiatric illness and chemical dependency impact an individual physically, psychologically, socially and spiritually. Whiteside Manor offers a residential treatment program that is centered on the complete individual. Our Dual Diagnosis services focus on mental health recovery and addiction recovery issues that may be afflicting an individual. The primary presenting problem of those we serve is specifically substance abuse with a mental disorder/ illness secondary. Services include therapy groups made up of similarly situated, dually diagnosed clients. Groups are low-impact, highly supportive and non-confrontational. Psychiatric services are provided as well as medication monitoring and management. Clients learn about their dual disorders and also the symptoms and techniques for relapse prevention for both disorders.This program provides:- Residential treatment- Counseling- Addiction services- Mental health care
Coverage: This program covers residents of the following counties: Riverside County, CA.

Description: The Mental Health Urgent Cares provide individualized support for adults experiencing mental health challenges. Staffed by a competent, caring team, a safe, supportive, recovery-oriented environment is provided, with an emphasis placed on safety, the reduction of symptoms, and the creation of a plan for continuing support and services.Services Include:- Mental health screening and assessment services- Medications to address the needs of those in crisis - Safe, efficient, trauma-informed, and least-restrictive setting- Timely discharge planning- Individualized services and supports- Peer Support- Psychiatric and medication support- Recovery education- Nutritional education- Health and recreation- Community coordination - Follow-upRI International – Riverside County has two 24/7 Mental Health Urgent Care Centers open. The Centers provides individualized support for adults experiencing mental health challenges in a supportive recovery-oriented environment. Needs and circumstances determine the length of time each guest spends at the Mental Health Urgent Care. Guests able to walk-in, or to be referred by mobile crisis teams or law enforcement for crisis and assessment services. Accepts Medicare, Medi-Cal, all major insurance. However, payment is not required to receive services. Visit in person for services or call for more information.
Coverage: This program covers residents of the following counties: Riverside County, CA.

Description:
Psychological Services of Riverside provides a range of evidence-based mental health services to individuals and families in the community.

This program provides:

- Mental health care

Specific services include:

- Individual therapy
- Couples and family therapy
- Child and adolescent therapy
- Group therapy
- Psychological testing

PSR offers in-person services at its office in Riverside, California, and remote services to any current resident of California. 

We currently offer services in both English and Spanish. 

PSR services are provided by pre-licensed doctoral trainees and licensed providers. The rates for pre-licensed clinicians start at or below the rates for comparable services of other mental health providers in the community. Licensed providers at PSR typically charge rates that are comparable to the going rate in the community.  Both levels have sliding fee scales, and grant funding may be available to help lower costs even further based on special circumstances. A client's insurance status does not affect their ability to utilize PSR's sliding fee scale.
Coverage: This program covers residents of the following states: CA.

Coverage: This program covers residents of the following counties: Riverside County, CA, San Bernardino County, CA and San Diego County, CA.

Main_Services: ['medical care', 'primary care', 'help find healthcare', 'mental health care', 'womens health', 'help pay for healthcare', 'understand government programs', 'health insurance', 'navigating the system', 'help fill out forms', 'advocacy & legal aid', 'representation']
Eligibility: ['Must reside in Riverside and San Bernardino Counties.', 'This program helps people with income at or below 200% of federal poverty guidelines.']
Description: The Health Law Practice Group at Inland Counties Legal Services focuses on obtaining and maintaining health benefits and increasing access to health services for clients. Attorneys and advocates offer free* assistance over-the-phone or in-person to help people who are struggling to obtain or maintain health coverage and resolve problems with their health plans. Depending on the circumstances of their case, a full range of services may be provided, including topics such as advising on health care eligibility, negotiating with health plans, filing health plan grievances, submitting Independent Medical Review with the Department of Managed Health Care, and administrative appeals against Medi-Cal and Covered California.This program provides:- Advocacy & legal aid- Assistance in understanding health coverage program eligibility- Assistance in obtaining and maintaining health coverageHealth Care Topics Include:- Medi-Cal- Medicare- Cal MediConnect- Covered California- Private Health Insurance- In-Home Supportive Services (IHSS)- Medical Billing- Medical Equipment Denials/Delays- Prescription Drug Coverage- Reduction or Termination of Medical Services- Quality Concerns- Other Health Care MattersIf eligible for services, clients may receive advice, brief services, and/or direct-representation depending on the circumstances of their case. Free* for those who qualify for services.Translation services are available free of charge.Seniors may call the Senior Line: 800-977-4257 for specialized service.
Coverage: This program covers residents of the following counties: Riverside County, CA and San Bernardino County, CA.

Description: Riverside County Department of Mental Health provides residential treatment to riverside county residents struggling with substance addiction. Main_Services: ['mental health care']
Serving: ['anyone in need', 'adults', 'young adults', 'teens', 'seniors', 'homeless', 'benefit recipients', 'uninsured', 'underinsured', 'all mental health']
Description:
Fallbrook Family Health Center offers Behavioral Health services that address the needs of the total individual - body, mind and spirit. Behavioral health issues can affect your daily life in many profound ways. 

We understand that every person is different, so we offer personalized care for your needs. Our services can include: 

- Treatment 
- Teen Counseling 
- Psychiatry 

Services are offered to the neediest in each community - the un-insured and under-insured, the working poor, those with limited ability to pay, the homeless, and the indigent. Services are provided at discounted (sliding fee scale) rates for those who qualify based on gross annual income and family size. Medi-Cal and Medicare are also accepted.
Coverage: This program covers residents of the following counties: Riverside County, CA.

Service_name: Inland Empire Autism Assessment Center of Excellence
Main_Services: ['understand mental health', 'mental health evaluation']
Eligibility: ['This program helps people who are younger than 21 years old']
Description:
The Autism Assessment Center is an evaluation-only center that provides a singular solution to a multi‐specialty evaluation process. Our transdisciplinary team of professionals include pediatric neurologists, general pediatricians, clinical psychologists, neurodevelopmental psychologists, educational psychologists, speech and language pathologists, occupational therapists, geneticists, behavioral health professionals, licensed social workers and MFTs, evaluation coordinators, and paraprofessional staff.

Services provided: 

- Evaluation for neurodevelopmental disorders such as Autism Spectrum Disorder
- Diagnosis

We see patients from birth until their 21st birthday. The evaluation will be a combination of parent/caregiver and child interview, observation, and play. Questions will pertain to family, parent, and child medical history, developmental milestones, cognitive functioning, behavior, communication and socialization, daily activities, home environment, education, mental health, and childhood adverse experiences. We ask that parents bring with them all pertinent information relating to their child’s health and current functional status, which may include reports from doctors, psychologists, and social workers, screening results, school paperwork and individualized education plans (IEPs), and documentation regarding any previous diagnoses.
Coverage: This program covers residents of the following counties: Riverside County, CA and San Bernardino County, CA.

Description: Stress and Your Mood (SAYM) is an evidence-based early intervention program (EBP) used to treat depression. The primary program goal is to reduce the duration and impact of depression for TAY (Transitional Age Youth ages 16 – 25) in Riverside County that are the target populations. This program provides:- Mental health support- Support network This early intervention is to be provided by a master’s level or higher clinician.  The program consists of weekly individual or group sessions (with a maximum of 8 TAY per group) for 10-20 sessions as prescribed by the Evidence Based Practice.
Coverage: This program covers residents of the following counties: Riverside County, CA.

Main_Services: ['medical care', 'primary care', 'checkup & test', 'disease screening', 'mental health evaluation', 'prevent & treat', 'disease management', 'vaccinations']
Description: The Primary Care program's physicians emphasize a holistic family approach.  The program provides comprehensive primary care to all ages, from infancy to old age, and make every effort to meet the unique needs of individuals with health problems. This program provides: - General medicine - Pediatrics - OB/GYN - Psychiatric services - Physical examinations - Diagnostic screenings - Immunizations - Well Baby - Treatment for Infectious Diseases - Management of Chronic Diseases such as Asthma and Allergies Family physicians treat patients of all ages, from infancy to old age. These physicians have the training to care for more than 90 percent of the problems for which patients consult doctors. This includes skin conditions, back pain and other musculoskeletal problems, headaches, routine gynecological care, chronic illnesses and many other diseases. If you have a unique problem that requires a specialist, our physicians will refer you to one and coordinate your care with them. Services are offered to the neediest in each community - the un-insured and under-insured, the working poor, those with limited ability to pay, the homeless, and the indigent. Services are provided at discounted (sliding fee scale) rates for those who qualify based on gross annual income and family size. Medi-Cal is also accepted.
Coverage: This program covers residents of the following counties: Riverside County, CA.
